info.name: hometex_api_v2
info.description:
# ðŸ›’ Get started here

This collection template is a blueprint demonstrating the core features of a complete online store following industry-standard architecture for a modern E-commerce system. You can use this template as inspiration to build your own custom API or extend it to work with one you've already started working on.

### ðŸ” Authentication and authorization

This template assumes the user making requests to the e-commerce store API would be authenticated, for example using a Bearer token. You can choose an authentication method to apply to the whole collection by selecting the collection and navigating to the Authorization tab.

## ðŸ”– How to use this collection?

#### Step 1: **Send the requests**

Send the requests and view the response returned by the mock API, or check out the examples included.

#### Step 2: **Update the base URL**

Select the collection and navigate to the â€œVariablesâ€ tab. Update the `baseUrl` variable with your API's URL.

#### **Step 3: Customize the requests**

Update the different parts of the requests to suit your use case, including the request body, authorization, documentation, headers, tests, and path parameters.

#### **Step 4: Continue building the collection**

Create requests in this collection to test the new API endpoints you develop.

## â„¹ï¸ Resources

[Building requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/)  
[Authorizing requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/)  
[Using variables](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/)  
[Creating your first collection](https://learning.postman.com/docs/getting-started/creating-the-first-collection/)

item.name: User management
Authentication

exec: // Storing the access token in the environment to be used in other endpoints

request.description:
Create a new user.

**Note:** If you want to add yourself as an admin, you can add a key named "role" and set the value "admin" as a part of the request body.

This request also has a test script that sets the authorization token received in the response in the `accessToken` collection variable. This helps you reuse the token in other requests easily.

item.name: Order
Order status

variable.description: Order ID

request.description:
Retrieve the status of the specified order.

Replace `:orderId` in the URL with the actual ID of the order you want to retrieve. The response will contain information about the order, including the order ID, customer details, items in the order, total amount, status, and timestamps for creation and last update.

response.name: 200 OK

variable.description: Order ID

request.description:
Update the status of the specified order.

Replace `:orderId` in the URL with the ID of the order you want to update. In the request body, provide the updated items for the order. The response will include information about the updated order, such as the order ID, customer details, updated items, total amount, and timestamps for creation and last update.

response.name: 200 OK

variable.description: Order ID

item.description:
This folder contains endpoints for managing the status of orders within the e-commerce system.

These endpoints allow you to retrieve and update the status of orders, providing visibility into the progress and current state of each order.

On order creation; order status will be,`Pending` other possible statuses of an order could be any of the following:

1. `Pending`: The order has been created but has not yet been processed or confirmed.
2. `Processing`: The order is being processed, including tasks like payment verification, inventory allocation, and order preparation.
3. `Shipped`: The order has been shipped or handed over to the shipping carrier for delivery. Shipping details will be added to order e.g. Courier, tracking number, etc.
4. `Delivered`: The order has been successfully delivered to the customer.
5. `Cancelled`: The order has been cancelled either by the customer or due to some other reason.  
    Returned: The order has been returned by the customer.
6. `Refunded`: The payment for the order has been refunded to the customer.
7. `On Hold`: The order is on hold for some reason, such as pending payment verification or investigation of a potential issue.
8. `Partially Shipped`: Only a portion of the order has been shipped, while the remaining items are still pending.
9. `Partially Delivered`: Only a portion of the order has been delivered, while the remaining items are still pending.

This folder provides requests for managing and utilizing different payment methods supported by our payment gateway service.

This functionality enables customers to make payments using various payment options, such as credit cards, digital wallets, and bank transfers.

Optional - Filters payments by the ID of the order associated with the payment.

The payment transaction includes information such as the total order amount, currency, shipping/billing address, and the items in the cart. The transaction serves as a record of the customer's intent to make a purchase.

This folder contains requests that allow the creation, retrieval, update, and deletion of transactions.

This folder provides a set of requests to handle refunds within the payment system.

item.name: Invoices

request.description:
Create a new invoice.

After sending the request, returns the details of the created invoice, including the invoice ID, order ID, status, and a message indicating the success of the operation.

variable.description: Invoice ID

request.description:
Retrieve details of a specific invoice.

Replace `:invoiceId` in the URL with the actual ID of the invoice you want to retrieve. The response will contain information about the invoice, including the invoice ID, order ID, from/to details, items in the invoice, tax details, payment terms, notes, and terms.

response.name: 200 OK

variable.description: Invoice ID

query.description: Optional - Status of invoices
Optional - Specifies the start date of the payment range. Payments created on or after this date will be included in the results. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.
Optional - Specifies the end date of the payment range. Payments created before or on this date will be included in the results. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

request.description:

Replace `:invoiceId` in the URL with the actual ID of the invoice you want to retrieve. The response will contain information about the invoice, including the invoice ID, order ID, from/to details, items in the invoice, tax details, payment terms, notes, and terms.

variable.description: Invoice ID

request.description:

Replace `:invoiceId` in the URL with the ID of the invoice you want to update. In the request body, provide the updated details for the invoice. The response will include information about the updated invoice, such as the invoice ID, order ID, from/to details, items, tax details, payment terms, notes, and terms.

item.name: Webhooks

request.description:
Create a new webhook to receive real-time notifications for payment, transaction, and refund events.

Whenever any of these events occur, the defined webhook `webhook_url` endpoint e.g. `https://api.example.com/webhook-listener-for-payment-gateway` will receive a POST request with relevant data.

variable.description: A specific webhook ID to retrieve

request.description: Retrieve the details of a specific webhook.

variable.description: A specific webhook ID to retrieve
A specific webhook ID to retrieve

request.description: Update the configuration of an existing webhook.

variable.description: A specific webhook ID to retrieve
A specific webhook ID to retrieve

request.description: Update the configuration of an existing webhook.

variable.description: A specific webhook ID to retrieve

query.description: Example event e.g. payment.created, payment.updated, transaction.created, transaction.updated, refund.created, refund.updated.

variable.description: A specific webhook ID to verify/test

request.description: Verify the webhook by sending a test payload with the specified event.

query.description: Example event e.g. payment.created, payment.updated, transaction.created, transaction.updated, refund.created, refund.updated.

variable.description: A specific webhook ID to verify/test

item.description:
Webhooks enable seamless updates and allow the platform to take immediate actions based on events within the payment system.

Possible events that can be supported by the webhook endpoints, along with their corresponding use cases:

1. `payment.created`: Receive a notification when a new payment is created in the system. This can be useful for order fulfillment, sending confirmation emails, or updating inventory.
2. `payment.updated`: Get notified when there are changes or updates to a payment, such as status changes or additional information being added. This can be helpful for tracking payment status or triggering follow-up actions.
3. `transaction.created`: Receive notifications when a new transaction is created, such as a successful purchase or a failed transaction. This can be used to update reporting systems, generate invoices, or trigger customer communication.
4. `transaction.updated`: Get notified when there are updates or changes to a transaction, such as a change in status or additional details being added. This can be useful for tracking transaction progress or triggering specific actions based on the updates.
5. `refund.created`: Receive notifications when a refund is initiated or created. This can be used to update accounting systems, trigger refund confirmation emails, or update customer records.
6. `refund.updated`: Get notified when there are updates or changes to a refund, such as a change in status or additional details being added. This can be helpful for tracking refund progress or triggering specific actions based on the updates.
This folder contains endpoints for managing transactions, payments, payment methods, refunds, and webhooks.

item.name: Address validation

request.description: Check whether an address is valid, and return it in a standardized format if so. This ensures the address is known and deliverable.

item.description: This folder contains a request for validating and standardizing an address.

item.name: Shipments

request.description: Calculate the cost of a given shipment, for example to let a user know before they proceed with an order.
Create a shipment request.
Get the details of a shipment by ID.
Update a shipment's status with a new tracking event. For example, to show that a shipment has been collected or reached a new hub.
Get the current tracking status of a shipment, as well as the tracking history showing the shipment's progress over time.
Cancel a shipment. This endpoint is a POST rather than DELETE as the shipment stays on record.

item.description: This folder contains requests that help you calculate shipping costs and create, view, and track shipments.
